p.s: Ankita Mitra is clearly positioned against the envoironmentenvironment pollution.
She tries to convince the reader to do sthsomething against it, to stop this pollution, by using strategies.
The article is written in a subjective way.
The author shows her opinion to us.
To convince the reader she uses many enumerations, for example in l. 6 no man, no animal, no plants or effects on sea life, on crops and on human health (l. 15/16).
With this rethoricalrhetorical device she underlines the arguments, by showing us three aspects or examples.
Another device is used in line 29 incurable diseases or in line 31 era of man extinction.
Here she uses negative words and exaggeration to underscore the nesseseritynecessity of the solution of this big problem.
OnOne of ther strategies is the inclusive language.
It were used only the prepositions we/our.
So it is clear that the problem of the pollution affects us all living beings on the earth.
She uses many describtiondescription of the earth (for example line 7: oxygen, nitrogen, ...) to show us miracle this earth is and that we should take care of it.
Moreover she uses formal language and uses many specific words of the nature field (l. 27: nitrogen fertilizers).
She uses many but also convincing arguments.
For this arguments she bases on facts that we all know about the environment pollution and also on sepcifyedspecified knollegeknowledge for this subject.
Moreover she uses an example (l. 32-35) to get us closer to the consequenzesconsequences of this big problem.
In the first paragraph (l. 36-40) the author appeals to the reader that we should do sthsomething emideatlyimmediately to stop it.
